text:
“Very well then!” he said, resolutely moving from the bridge. 

His heart felt hollow. He didn’t want to think. 

“Is this really the end?” he wondered. 

He walked slowly along the canal bank. 

“How tired I am! If only I could sit down.” 

He paused at the first turning. 

After a moment, he turned into a side street. 

“Maybe I’m just delaying,” he thought, looking at the ground. 

Suddenly, a whisper urged him. 

He lifted his head. 

He stood at the gate of the house. 

An overwhelming impulse drew him inside. 

He climbed the dark, narrow staircase to the fourth storey.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The protagonist experiences a profound sense of apathy and confusion as he contemplates his fate while walking towards the police office.
